results.title: Australian diary. No. 001
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following itms are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: seventy 16 footer class yachts race on Sydney Harbour; cattle being sold at Wodonga after travelling on the hoof; pineapple harvesting in Queensland; an expert and his children demonstrate boomerang throwing; the University of Western Australia and St. George’s College are shown; surfriding on huge seas at Manly is shown.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scientific observations of the Heron Island research staion on the Great Barrier Reef. Illustrates in detail the birds, fish and mammals of the area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kit Guyatt, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Road observation
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “How to Drive”.
Shows what to look for in driving, the effect of speed on vision and typical signs and hazards.

results.title: Railways at work
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Transport in Australia”.
Shows the vital role of railways in Australia’s economy. Includes scenes from each state to illustrate rolling stock, services and people who depend on railways, directly or indirectly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australia calling
results.brief_description: A panorama of Australia, moving from Western Australia through South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, the A.C.T., N.S.W. and Queensland. Scenes include timber getting, gold mining, grape and apple harvests, dairying, skiing, Federal Parliament, Sydney attractions, Blue Mountains, caves and beaches, cane cutting and the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Ride like a champion
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Members of a Police and Citizens Boys’ Club demonstrate faulty and careless riding of bicycles. A police sergeant instructs them in the correct methods and demonstrates correct hand signals. Shows how to maintaine the bicycle and how to care for the reflector, brakes, chain, tires and the wheels. A group-cycling trip is used to illustrate elements of road care and courtesy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Pearlers
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the pearling industry on the northern coast of Australia. Shows the preparation of the diver before going below; the hazardous work as he gathers pearl shell from the sea floor; opening the shells, searching for pearls and packing the shell on board the lugger; return of the lugger to port and packing of the shell for export.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Cane cutters
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: One of the “Interesting Australians” series which showed Australians at work. The first person, poetic commentary describes the life and work of cane cutters and celebrates their mateship and their sense of belonging to ‘the good earth of tropical Australia’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh McInnes, John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
